intro: Symplocos ophirensis var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran symplocos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
